page.title: 01Introduction
page.content:
PRESTBURY
Prestbury is one of the very picturesque villages in Cheshire. Its best known landmark is perhaps the Norman Church of Saint Peter. The shops along the main road are painted black and white and many have bow windows. The National Westminster Bank is a Tudor building dating back to 1448. Prestbury is a rural residential area with many superior homes and gardens that are outstandingly beautiful. Its charming buildings and choice of restaurants make Prestbury an attraction for tourists from all over the world.
